comments.text: This component is good for one-off media queries. In general it is better to use the queries defined in "Match Media Query"

roots.label: Check what breakpoints are currently in the Active Media Queries array

parameters.functionScript:
if (!Inputs.activeQueryArray) return

Outputs['Matches Small Mobile'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Small Mobile')
Outputs['Matches Regular Mobile'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Regular Mobile')
Outputs['Matches Tablet'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Tablet')
Outputs['Matches Regular Desktop'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Regular Desktop')
Outputs['Matches Large Desktop'] = Inputs.activeQueryArray.includes('Large Desktop')

comments.text: This component is used to detect the currently active media query.
"Small Mobile" and "Large Desktop" can be considered edge cases, so we combine all mobile and desktop checks as a shorthand.
This component shows the current content of the Active Media Queries array.

Media queries are created and cleaned up here. 

If you add queries, make sure to include them in the "Match Media Query" component as well.
Used to store an array of the identifiers for the media queries that are currently active

IMPORTANT:

This component should be placed in your home component. 

It should not be used more than once.
The default breakpoints can be edited here
